name: Fundación Secretariado Gitano
goal:
The Fundación Secretariado Gitano (FSG) is an intercultural social organisation that has been working for more than 35 years on promoting and securing equal opportunities for the Roma community in Spain and Europe.

FSG develops projects and offers services to guarantee and defend Roma access to rights, mainly in the fields of employment, education, health and housing. It also works to promote more active policies for the social inclusion of the Roma population, to fight discrimination and to guarantee equality for all.

The mission of the Fundación Secretariado Gitano is the comprehensive advancement of the Roma community through pursuing cultural diversity. We seek equal opportunities, social change and personal advancement through the promotion of people's potential.

FSG is a registered foundation in Spain, with 55 offices across the country, and an intercultural team of 842 employees and 426 volunteers (as of 31/03/2019), implementing 549 programmes with around 30,000 beneficiaries (as of 31/15/2019).

For further information, see Fundación Secretariado Gitano (FSG) website www.gitanos.org
interests: Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Communication, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
The Fundación Secretariado Gitano closely monitors a wide range of EU initiatives, policies and legislation of relevance for the promotion of labour market, social and economic inclusion and human rights of vulnerable groups, in particular Roma.
These include:
•EU Framework for National Roma Integration Strategies (NRIS)
•Multiannual Financial Framework and European Structural and Investment Funds (ESI Funds), notably European Social Fund+ and European Regional Development Fund/Cohesion Fund
•European Code of Conduct on Partnership
•European Pillar of Social Rights- European Semester
•Youth Guarantee
•Child guarantee
•European Commission's strategy to support high quality, inclusive and future-oriented school and higher education
•Code of Conduct to counter illegal hate speech
•Sustainable Development Goals
•European Parliament resolutions/other initiatives in relation to antigypsyism and Roma equality
•Follow-up of implementation of Directive 2000/43 Equal Treatment at national level
